body:
I have attached the file with everything internalized. Probably best to open the one that says (Simulation Off) as the other will just run when opened and it is a pretty long simulation.
This is a study for a wall where we want to analyze its openings. I made a parametric wall that then get's analyzed with different geometries and the idea was just to leave it there for the weekend as it morphed through different iterations.

However, after successfully running a test simulation on my pc (just with one iteration), it fails to run the same test on the workplace computer. Any help would be greatly apprecated! Here is the following error:
topic: Daylight simulation working on one computer but failing on another

replies.body:
A couple of us have had a similar issue moving between home and workplace computers.

[http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/error-w-hon...](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/error-w-honeybee-rundaylightanalysis-and-gencumsky-components)

[http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/cannot-find...](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/cannot-find-function-file-1)



Try finding the simulation batch file in your ladybug root folder at work, i.e. C:\ladybug\skylib\umulativeSkies\yourCity\... and run it manually with admin access. After that test your script again and it should work.
To me, it looks like a different issue. What happens when you tried Saeran's suggestion?

Hi all, I have the same issue and it seems it depends on the type of Sky used.

However, I have still not found a solution (on my pc doesn't work, on my friend's pc yes)



Any idea?

Thanks,



Riccardo
